body_html:
@ragulpr Thanks for your follow up.
I don't think the tests would fail because somehow even in spatial_softmax layer implementation width and height are reversed, here.

      pos_x, pos_y = array_ops.meshgrid(
          math_ops.lin_space(-1., 1., num=height),
          math_ops.lin_space(-1., 1., num=width),
          indexing='ij')
body_text:
@ragulpr Thanks for your follow up.
I don't think the tests would fail because somehow even in spatial_softmax layer implementation width and height are reversed, here.
      pos_x, pos_y = array_ops.meshgrid(
          math_ops.lin_space(-1., 1., num=height),
          math_ops.lin_space(-1., 1., num=width),
          indexing='ij')
body:
@ragulpr Thanks for your follow up.
I don't think the tests would fail because somehow even in spatial_softmax layer implementation width and height are reversed, [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.11/tensorflow/contrib/layers/python/layers/layers.py#L2960). 

```sh
      pos_x, pos_y = array_ops.meshgrid(
          math_ops.lin_space(-1., 1., num=height),
          math_ops.lin_space(-1., 1., num=width),
          indexing='ij')
```
